intro: Souroubea bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia souroubea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
